channel.title: Help with no-ip (if you can portforward, LOOK HERE PLEASE)
channel.description:
If you ask alot of questions in this section you may know me to answer [i]your[/i] questions. Now I need your help , I have a BtHomeHub router and I wanna add a manual entry of port maps, please tell me what to put in theese boxes (there is a small reward) ;) Thanks [img]http://www.knowledgebase.fusiveweb.co.uk/Portals/38893/8.bmp[/img] Thanks again. (I need to know what to put in the drop down boxes aswell!) You could post your answer like this:
[b]Protocol: Port Range: -From: -To: Translate to: Trigger protocol: Trigger port: [/b]
By the way, my server's port is 43594 (default) Cheers

item.title: Help with no-ip (if you can portforward, LOOK HERE PLEASE)
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

[quote=“leetzone, post:6, topic:168783”]You can do Application name RSPS and i did
Protocol - TCP
Protocol - TCP
Then make another Application name
Protocol - UDP
Protocol - UDP

it works fine for me :)[/quote]

why would you need to make two different ones for each protocol, when selecting any will do the exact same thing, with half the effort

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Help with no-ip (if you can portforward, LOOK HERE PLEASE)
item.dc:creator: @leetzone leetzone
item.description:
@leetzone wrote:

You can do Application name RSPS and i did
Protocol - TCP
Protocol - TCP
Then make another Application name
Protocol - UDP
Protocol - UDP

it works fine for me

Read full topic
